title: Component
desc: A component is a reusable piece of code that can be used in multiple places in your application.

title: Button
desc: A button is an interactive element used to trigger actions or events when clicked by the user.

title: Card
desc: A card is a container used to group related information and can include media, text, and actions.

title: Modal
desc: A modal is a dialog box that appears over the main content, often used for user confirmation or form input.

title: Input Field
desc: An input field allows users to enter and edit text in a form.

title: Navbar
desc: A navbar provides a consistent navigation interface across different pages of an application.

title: Sidebar
desc: A sidebar is a vertical menu typically used to provide access to various sections of an application.

title: Tooltip
desc: A tooltip displays additional information when a user hovers over or focuses on an element.

title: Accordion
desc: An accordion is a vertically stacked list of items that can be expanded or collapsed to reveal content.

title: Dropdown
desc: A dropdown allows users to choose one option from a list that appears when activated.

title: Badge
desc: A badge is a small count or label that appears on an element to provide additional information.

title: Toast
desc: A toast is a small, non-intrusive message displayed temporarily to inform users of something.

title: Spinner
desc: A spinner indicates that a process or action is loading or taking place.

title: Progress Bar
desc: A progress bar visually represents the progress of a task or process.

title: Tabs
desc: Tabs allow navigation between different views or sections of content in the same space.

title: Avatar
desc: An avatar is a graphical representation of a user, often used in profiles or chat apps.

title: Slider
desc: A slider lets users select a value from a range by moving a handle along a track.

title: Checkbox
desc: A checkbox allows users to select one or more options from a set.

title: Radio Button
desc: A radio button allows users to select a single option from a group.

title: Table
desc: A table displays data in rows and columns, making it easier to read and compare.
